thread.title: Hammond back with Senators, ahead of schedule
thread.title_full: Hammond back with Senators, ahead of schedule

title: Hammond back with Senators, ahead of schedule
text:
Ottawa Senators 
The Senators did some goalie shuffling before heading off to Columbus Tuesday afternoon. 
Andrew Hammond was declared good to return from a groin injury that had sidelined him for the start of the season, meaning rookie Matt O’Connor was sent to the AHL affiliate in Binghamton. 
Craig Anderson is expected to get the start Wednesday, when the 2-1-0 Senators take on the Blue Jackets at Nationwide Arena. 
Hammond, who led Ottawa to the playoffs last spring, said he’s been skating by himself for the last four or five days. 
“We started slow, then kind of ramped it up and the last two days have kind of been full go,” he said. “I think we’re at a point now I feel good, there’s no pain. We’re all good at this point.” 
Hammond said he was “surprised” when told he would miss the first two weeks of the season with the injury. 
“I think we’re coming in a little shy of that,” he said, “but I’ve always been someone who kind of heals quickly. So to have it drag on long than I thought … in my mind I thought I was going to be ready for the opener, and when it comes to be the day before and you’re really not close, you get a little discouraged. 
“But obviously the fact I’m back a little ahead of the timeline is good. The work I’ve done now has obviously helped a lot.”
